intro: Mentha simplex, commonly known as field mint, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its square, hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are often fragrant. The plant produces small, pale blue or violet flowers in whorled clusters, typically blooming from June to August. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Mentha simplex is widely used in herbal medicine for its refreshing scent and various therapeutic properties.
